main.name: Nick Figgins
main.description: Currently, I'm looking for full-time opportunities starting after my graduation in May 2021
main.bio: I'm currently going into my final year as an undergraduate at the University of Virginia. After graduating, I will be pursuing a career in software engineering or cybersecurity. Outisde of technology, I enjoy travelling, listening to music, making music, and football.
main.contactmessage: Please fill out the form below, or directly email me at nef7xb@virginia.edu.

resume.skillmessage: Through working with both machine learning libraries and web development frameworks (Flask, DJango), I've gained strong experience working with Python. I've also gained experience working with C++, C, and x86 Assembly through coursework. Throughout this past summer, I've been working on learning React.js and further improving my JavaScript skills in doing so. This website (and another one coming soon) were created with React.

education.degree: B.A. in Computer Science; B.A. in Mathematics

education.description: I also received my General Certificate from Lord Fairfax Community College for the completion of 30 college credits while in high-school (I completed 61 total).

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: I worked as a back-end engineer for the Callie mobile app and the brand representative web portal.

work.title: Coding Instructor
work.description: I taught courses to K-12 students on various programming languages and concepts, including Java/OOP, boolean logic, and game design with Lua (C++ scripting language).

work.company: University of Virginia - Security Operations Center
work.title: Information Security Intern

research.subject: Adversarial Machine Learning Malware Classification
research.title: Undergraduate Researcher
research.description: I'm currently researching defenses to evasive attacks towards Windows malware classifiers. In particular, I'm looking into defenses against the easily perturbed headers of PE files, which has been the focus of recent attack algorithms.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
